## Serializable() function

A decorator that makes a class serializable by implementing toString() and toJSON() methods. The target class must implement static `parse`<!-- -->, `safeParse`<!-- -->, and `stringify` methods.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function Serializable<T extends Fn.Newable & {
    parse: Fn.Callable<{
        return: InstanceType<T>;
    }>;
    safeParse: Fn.Callable<{
        return: SafeResult<InstanceType<T>>;
    }>;
    stringify: Fn.Callable<{
        args: [InstanceType<T>];
        return: string;
    }>;
}>(targetClass: T): T;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

targetClass


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The class to make serializable


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

T

A proxy of the decorated class with `toString()`<!-- -->, `toJSON()` instance methods and `safeParse` static method

## Remarks

The decorated class must implement: - static parse(value: string): Instance - Converts a string to class instance - static safeParse(value: string): SafeResult<Instance> - Converts a string to class instance with error handling - static stringify(value: Instance): string - Converts class instance to string

\*\* Note: \*\* The `safeParse` method is automatically created by the decorator.

The decorator automatically: - Adds toString() and toJSON() instance methods that use the stringify implementation - Creates a safeParse static method that wraps the parse method with error handling

## Example


```ts
@Serializable
class Example {
  constructor(public readonly text: string) {}

  static parse(value: string): Example {
    return new Example(value);
  }

  static stringify(value: Example): string {
    return value.text;
  }
}

const example = Example.parse("example");
example.toString(); // "example"
JSON.stringify(example); // "example"

const result = Example.safeParse("example"); // { success: true, data: Example }
if (result.success) {
  result.data.toString(); // "example"
} else {
  result.error; // Error
}
```
